solution_line_template: There are {days_in_week} days in a week and {daily_recommendation} cups are recommended per day, bringing the total to {days_in_week} days * {daily_recommendation} cups/day =<<{days_in_week}*{daily_recommendation}={total_weekly_requirement}>>{total_weekly_requirement} cups for the week.

Out of the {total_weekly_requirement} total cups needed for the week, Sarah has already eaten {cups_already_eaten}, for a total of {total_weekly_requirement} cups - {cups_already_eaten} cups = <<{total_weekly_requirement}-{cups_already_eaten}={cups_left}>>{cups_left} cups left to consume for the week.

Sunday through Thursday equals {days_passed} days that have passed. If there are {days_in_week} days in the week then Sarah has {days_in_week} days - {days_passed} days = <<{days_in_week}-{days_passed}={days_left}>>{days_left} days left of the week.

If she needs to eat {cups_left} more cups in the next {days_left} days then she will have to eat {cups_left} cups / {days_left} days = <<{cups_left}/{days_left}={cups_per_day_needed}>>{cups_per_day_needed} cups per day over the next two days.
